column18: To the shareholder of Bloomhearing ApS
column23: The annual report is presented in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column24: In our opinion, the financial statements give a true and fair view of the Entityâs financial position at 30.04.2018 and of the results of its operations for the financial year 01.05.2017 - 30.04.2018.
column29: Gross profit for the year amounts to DKK 326 thousand compared DKK 317 thousand last year. The ordinary result after tax amounts to DKK 221 thousand compared to DKK 205 thousand last year. Result for the year corresponds to management's expectations.
column30: Current tax receivable or payable is recognised in the balance sheet, stated as tax computed on this year's taxable income, adjusted for prepaid tax.
column31: Depreciation, amortisation and impairment losses relating to intangible assets comprise amortisation and impairment losses for the financial year, calculated on the basis of the residual values and useful lives of the individual assets and impairment testing as well as gains and losses from the sale of intangible assets.
column33: Other external expenses include expenses relating to the Entityâs ordinary activities, including expenses for administration.
column34: Other financial income comprises interest income, including interest income on receivables from group enterprises, net capital or exchange gains on securities, payables and transactions in foreign currencies, amortisation of financial assets as well as tax relief under the Danish Tax Prepayment Scheme etc.
column35: Gross profit or loss comprises revenue and external expenses.
column36: Other financial liabilities are measured at amortised cost, which usually corresponds to nominal value.
column37: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, usually equalling nominal value less writedowns for bad and doubtful debts.
column38: Revenue from the sale of manufactured goods and goods for resale is recognised in the income statement when delivery is made and risk has passed to the buyer.
column39: Tax for the year, which consists of current tax for the year and changes in deferred tax, is recognised in the income statement by the portion attributable to the profit for the year and recognised directly in equity by the portion attributable to entries directly in equity. The Entity is jointly taxed with all Danish subsidiaries. The current Danish income tax is allocated among the jointly taxed entities proportionally to their taxable income (full allocation with a refund concerning tax losses).
column40: The Companyâs main activity is to own and administrate trademarks.
column41: We conducted our audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (ISAs) and additional requirements applicable in Denmark. Our responsibilities under those standards and requirements are further described in the Auditorâs responsibilities for the audit of the financial statements section of this auditorâs report. We are independent of the Entity in accordance with the International Ethics Standards Board of Accountants' Code of Ethics for Professional Accountants (IESBA Code) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.
column42: No events have occurred after the balance sheet date to this date, which would influence the evaluation of this annual report.
column43: The accounting policies applied to these financial statements are consistent with those applied last year.
column44: The Entity participates in a Danish joint taxation arrangement where Widex Holding A/S serves as the administration company. According to the joint taxation provisions of the Danish Corporation Tax Act, the Entity is therefore liable for income taxes etc for the jointly taxed entities, and for obligations, if any, relating to the withholding of tax on interest, royalties and dividend for the jointly taxed entities. The jointly taxed entities' total known net liability under the joint taxation arrangement is disclosed in the administration company's financial statements.
column48: The Board of Directors and the Executive Board have today considered and approved the annual report of Bloomhearing ApS for the financial year 01.05.2017 - 30.04.2018.
column50: We believe that the management commentary contains a fair review of the affairs and conditions referred to therein.
column63: We recommend the annual report for adoption at the Annual General Meeting.

column33: Other external expenses include expenses relating to the Entityâs ordinary activities, including expenses for administration.
column34: Other financial income comprises interest income, including interest income on receivables from group enterprises, net capital or exchange gains on securities, payables and transactions in foreign currencies, amortisation of financial assets as well as tax relief under the Danish Tax Prepayment Scheme etc.
column35: Gross profit or loss comprises revenue and external expenses.
column36: Other financial liabilities are measured at amortised cost, which usually corresponds to nominal value.
column37: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, usually equalling nominal value less writedowns for bad and doubtful debts.
column38: Revenue from the sale of manufactured goods and goods for resale is recognised in the income statement when delivery is made and risk has passed to the buyer.
column39: Tax for the year, which consists of current tax for the year and changes in deferred tax, is recognised in the income statement by the portion attributable to the profit for the year and recognised directly in equity by the portion attributable to entries directly in equity. The Entity is jointly taxed with all Danish subsidiaries. The current Danish income tax is allocated among the jointly taxed entities proportionally to their taxable income (full allocation with a refund concerning tax losses).
column40: The Companyâs main activity is to own and administrate trademarks.

column44: The Entity participates in a Danish joint taxation arrangement where Widex Holding A/S serves as the administration company. According to the joint taxation provisions of the Danish Corporation Tax Act, the Entity is therefore liable for income taxes etc for the jointly taxed entities, and for obligations, if any, relating to the withholding of tax on interest, royalties and dividend for the jointly taxed entities. The jointly taxed entities' total known net liability under the joint taxation arrangement is disclosed in the administration company's financial statements.

According to the joint taxation provisions of the Danish Corporation Tax Act, the Entity is therefore liable for income taxes etc for the jointly taxed entities, and for obligations, if any, relating to the withholding of tax on interest, royalties and dividend for the jointly taxed entities. The jointly taxed entities' total known net liability under the joint taxation arrangement is disclosed in the administration company's financial statements.

column30: Current tax receivable or payable is recognised in the balance sheet, stated as tax computed on this year's taxable income, adjusted for prepaid tax.
column31: Depreciation, amortisation and impairment losses relating to intangible assets comprise amortisation and impairment losses for the financial year, calculated on the basis of the residual values and useful lives of the individual assets and impairment testing as well as gains and losses from the sale of intangible assets.
column33: Other external expenses include expenses relating to the Entityâs ordinary activities, including expenses for administration.
column34: Other financial income comprises interest income, including interest income on receivables from group enterprises, net capital or exchange gains on securities, payables and transactions in foreign currencies, amortisation of financial assets as well as tax relief under the Danish Tax Prepayment Scheme etc.
column35: Gross profit or loss comprises revenue and external expenses.
column36: Other financial liabilities are measured at amortised cost, which usually corresponds to nominal value.
column37: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, usually equalling nominal value less writedowns for bad and doubtful debts.
column38: Revenue from the sale of manufactured goods and goods for resale is recognised in the income statement when delivery is made and risk has passed to the buyer.
column39: Tax for the year, which consists of current tax for the year and changes in deferred tax, is recognised in the income statement by the portion attributable to the profit for the year and recognised directly in equity by the portion attributable to entries directly in equity. The Entity is jointly taxed with all Danish subsidiaries. The current Danish income tax is allocated among the jointly taxed entities proportionally to their taxable income (full allocation with a refund concerning tax losses).
